title: Flow: The Psychology of Optimal Experience
summary: Flow is a state of optimal experience characterized by deep immersion and enjoyment. It occurs when there is a balance between the challenge of the task and the skill of the user, along with clear goals and immediate feedback.

effectiveness_metrics.description: Flow represents the peak of intrinsic motivation and performance, where time perception is distorted and self-consciousness disappears.

mechanisms.name: Challenge-Skill Balance
mechanisms.description: The task must be difficult enough to be interesting but not so difficult as to cause anxiety.

mechanisms.name: Clear Goals
mechanisms.description: The user must know exactly what needs to be done next.

mechanisms.name: Immediate Feedback
mechanisms.description: The user must receive constant signals about how well they are doing.

actionable_strategies.name: Goldilocks Challenge Template
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: Dynamically adjust the 'focus block' duration or the complexity of the micro-activity based on the user's current energy and past performance to keep them in the 'flow channel'.

actionable_strategies.name: Micro-Feedback Loop
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: Ensure every small interaction (e.g., completing a micro-task) has an immediate, satisfying visual or haptic response to maintain the feedback loop.
